name: Weaving a Tale
description: Benny Russell and Kay Eaton find themselves aboard the space station from Benny's stories. Astonished as they are, the reality of being ripped from their time quickly hits them. But the best way to adjust may just lie at the heart of a good story.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using B. Sisko, Joe Sisko, Kira, or Writers will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: B. Sisko, Joe Sisko, Kira, or Writers
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Darlene
featured_crew.flavor: Darlene Kursky was a secretary at Incredible Stories. She was fond of science fiction, and Benny’s story delighted her.

featured_crew.name: Preacher
featured_crew.flavor: A preacher appearing in Sisko’s visions of Benny Russell. His cryptic words hinted at something beyond the surface.

action.name: Go Now And Write The Truth

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Jake
rewards.flavor: During the Dominion occupation of Terok Nor, Jake writes articles for the Federation News Service

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.name: Darlene
rewards.flavor: Darlene Kursky was a secretary at Incredible Stories. She was fond of science fiction, and Benny’s story delighted her.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Darlene
rewards.flavor: Darlene Kursky was a secretary at Incredible Stories. She was fond of science fiction, and Benny’s story delighted her.

rewards.name: Rarity

rewards.name: Preacher
rewards.flavor: A preacher appearing in Sisko’s visions of Benny Russell. His cryptic words hinted at something beyond the surface.

action.name: Go Now And Write The Truth

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Find a good story with the Federation.

rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "This has to be a dream...there's no other explanation. You're telling me that we've been whisked off to the future. That the stories of Commander Sisko and the space station he oversees, tales too unthinkable for some people of my day, have actually become a future reality?"
"I can't believe time travel is real. Though it's not as smooth or predictable as the time travel we were writing about. And to think...we don't know how or if we'll be able to get home. Julius..."

"We're here, we're really here. And yet, something feels off. When a man spends so long, risks so much, in pursuit of a dream, even if just to share it with the world, what is he to do when it's finally become reality?"

"The dream has only just begun. Explore it. Take it in. You don't find yourself in a good dream just to ask when you'll have to wake up. Let it take you where it will and perhaps you'll find a bit of inspiration for your next chapter."

"This has to be a dream...there's no other explanation. You're telling me that we've been whisked off to the future. That the stories of Commander Sisko and the space station he oversees, tales too unthinkable for some people of my day, have actually become a future reality?"
"I can't believe time travel is real. Though it's not as smooth or predictable as the time travel we were writing about. And to think...we don't know how or if we'll be able to get home. Julius..."

"We're here, we're really here. And yet, something feels off. When a man spends so long, risks so much, in pursuit of a dream, even if just to share it with the world, what is he to do when it's finally become reality?"

"The dream has only just begun. Explore it. Take it in. You don't find yourself in a good dream just to ask when you'll have to wake up. Let it take you where it will and perhaps you'll find a bit of inspiration for your next chapter."

"Thanks for helping us get acquainted with the future and Benny's space station, Captain. I can't say I'm settled, but at least it feels a little less overwhelming. And hey, we even stumbled upon a space mystery of our own. A brand new genre, perhaps?"

"Benny's space station? That has a nice ring to it. And I heard you two got embroiled in the matter outside of Quark's bar and offered to find the truth. The constable is on it - don't you think it's a tall order for you just having arrived in the future?"

responses.text: "This isn't a civilian matter, and with the Klingons, it's extra precarious."
"It could be dangerous, especially when Klingons and hurt pride are involved."

screens.text: "Actually, I think it's just what we both need. And maybe we can be of more help to you than one would expect with this Quark and the case of the tainted tea. You Starfleet officers work from a place of science and logic; however we writers thrive on imagination and possibility."
"I want to get some more information on this ceremony, but something didn't seem to be adding up, with this Quark fellow or those Klingons."

"Haha, there were some members of the Starfleet in my stories as steadfast in adhering to the rules as you seem to be. Even the fantasies of space come with their own mundanities, huh? We won't get in the way, but really, I think we can be of help."
"Well, I don't know much about these Klingons - they did look pretty intimidating - but you'll be with us for protection, right, Captain?"
"I think it's worth a shot. Just make sure you don't do anything to anger the Klingons involved any further. And Captain, I'm counting on you to keep our newest authors-in-residence safe."

"Thanks for helping us get acquainted with the future and Benny's space station, Captain. I can't say I'm settled, but at least it feels a little less overwhelming. And hey, we even stumbled upon a space mystery of our own. A brand new genre, perhaps?"
